title: How do carers feel about their involvement in discussions on the social care the person they care for receives?
analysis_commentary:
There is regional variation in the proportion of carers who felt involved in discussions about the social care the person they care for received. The East Midlands had the lowest proportion of carers who always or usually felt involved or consulted in 2014-15, at 46.5%. This is 17.2 percentage points below the highest seen in the North East and 7.8 percentage points below the national average of 54.3%. The responses included those who say that no discussions have happened in the last 12 months.
From 2009-10, the data was not aggregated in regional groups, so is not included here. More than half of regions reported lower proportions of carers feeling involved in discussions in 2014-15 than 2012-13.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services Survey of Adult Carers in England
